node.title: 'That's a loophole': Queensland health authorities to examine gap in testing rules for interstate hotspot visits
node.alt: Dr Peter AitkenÂ speaks at a press conference in Brisbane
node.description: Acting Chief Health Officer Peter Aitken says there is a "loophole" in the state's roadmap that would allow Queenslanders to visit hotspot locations interstate and return without being tested for COVID while they are there.
node.content:
["Queensland authorities will examine \"a loophole\" in the demand for COVID testing that could allow people to travel to hotspots and return to Queensland without being tested interstate.", "Acting Chief Health Officer Peter Aitken said the testing\u00a0rules once the state's borders open to COVID-19 hotspots would be reconsidered after he\u00a0confirmed Queensland had recorded no new cases in the previous 24 hours.", "Under state's COVID roadmap, when 80 per cent of the state's population over 16 is double-dose vaccinated, Queenslanders will be able to visit hotspots and return without going quarantine, provided\u00a0they have\u00a0tested negative in the previous 72 hours.", "Dr Aitken said\u00a0a loophole in the rules meant Queenslanders could be tested before leaving, then visit a hotspot and return without being tested in the hotspot being visited.", "\"I think that's a loophole that we will look at,\" Dr Aitken said.", "\"It's certainly not the intent [of the rule].", "\"The intent is for people to get a test in the area they've been exposed to.", "\"That's what we want Queenslanders to do and I think that's what Queenslanders will do \u2014\u00a0the sensible thing is to have a test after they've been exposed.\"", "But Dr Aitken acknowledged there would\u00a0be people who take advantage of the loophole.", "\"There's people out there that will speed on our roads as well, but this is there to protect Queensland and we trust Queenslanders to do the right thing,\" he said.", "He said Queensland Health would take a closer look at the \"loophole\".", "Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk also announced that Gold Coast infectious diseases expert John Gerrard would\u00a0become the state's new chief health officer from the middle of next month.", "", "
Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said it was not too late for Queenslanders to get vaccinated.(ABC News)
", "
Interstate testing requirement to stay until 90pc double dose
", "Ms Palaszczuk stood firm on the state government's requirement for all travellers returning from hotspots\u00a0to have a PCR test within 72 hours \u2014 despite it costing $150 per test for anyone who had\u00a0no COVID symptoms.", "The Premier said the policy was\u00a0likely to stay \"until we get to that 90 per cent double dose\".", "\"They're also required in other states as well, it's not just Queensland,\" she said.", "\"We make no apologies for keeping Queenslanders safe, it is the same that is required in other states, this is not just unique to Queensland.", "\"We are in a unique situation here, we have had zero cases for many, many days now, we are getting our vaccination rates up, this is one of the first times that we've done this anywhere in the world and Queenslanders want to be kept safe.", "\"This is a measure that has been put in place and will remain in place on the advice of our Chief Health Officer.", "\"We've announced our plan, and the plan is staying.\"", "The Premier was then asked if the requirement to pay for a PCR test would exclude border zone communities wanting to do daytrips for recreation.", "\"I'll look into that but probably not at this stage,\" she said."]
